Procedural Memory.description: The unconscious memory of how to do things.

Skill Acquisition.description: The process of learning a new skill through repetition and refinement.

Habit Formation.description: The development of automatic behaviors through repeated actions.

Practice.description: Repeated performance of a task to improve proficiency.

Feedback.description: Information about the outcome of an action, used to guide further learning.

Repetition.description: Repeated execution of a behavior leading to proceduralization.

Reward.description: Positive consequences that strengthen the likelihood of repeating a behavior.

Motor Skills.description: Skills involving the movement of the body.

Cognitive Skills.description: Skills involving mental processes and reasoning.

Error Correction.description: Adjustments made in response to errors during skill acquisition.

Performance Improvement.description: Enhanced skill execution due to practice and feedback.

Automaticity.description: The ability to perform a task without conscious thought.

Muscle Memory.description: The encoding of motor skills in the nervous system.

Reinforcement.description: The strengthening of a behavior through rewards.

Motivation.description: The drive to learn and improve a skill.

Adaptation.description: The ability to adjust a skill to different contexts.

Refinement.description: Increased accuracy and smoothness of skill execution.

Efficiency.description: Improved performance with less expenditure of resources.

Accuracy.description: The degree to which a skill is performed correctly.

Unconscious Processing.description: Execution of a skill without conscious awareness.

Effortless Execution.description: Performing a skill with minimal cognitive load.

Neural Pathways.description: Connections in the brain that support procedural memory.

Positive Feedback Loop.description: A cycle of reward that reinforces behavior.

Habit Strengthening.description: The process of making a habit stronger and more automatic.

Goal Setting.description: Defining specific objectives for skill acquisition.

Flexibility.description: Adaptability of a skill to different situations.

Generalization.description: Applying a learned skill to new contexts.

Fluency.description: Smooth and effortless execution of a skill.

Reduced Effort.description: Less energy and cognitive resources needed for skill execution.
